titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1000) to amend title I of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 and the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide additional protections to participants and beneficiaries in individual account plans from excessive investment in employer securities and to promote the provision of retirement investment advice to workers managing their retirement income assets.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 108-98, by Mr. Linder.
The amendment recommended by the Committee on Education and the Workforce now printed in the bill shall be considered as adopted. All points of order against the bill, as amended, are waived.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 40.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 230.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 218 - 201 (Roll no. 186).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 5/14/2003--Passed House without amendment. (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced in the House on May 13, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R.1000 (protections for participants and beneficiaries in individual account plans from excessive investment in employer securities).
